sprintGoal: Implement comprehensive notification system and social features

tasks.title: Implement notification system backend
tasks.description: Create unified notification system with in-app, email, and push delivery channels
acceptanceCriteria: Notification types: news (new articles in followed categories, trending), forum (replies, mentions, upvotes, accepted_answer), jobs (new matches, status_updates, profile_views), social (new_followers, messages, badges_earned, reputation_milestones)
Smart bundling: '3 people replied to your topic' instead of 3 separate notifications
Notification preferences per type and channel
Frequency control: real-time, hourly_digest, daily_digest, weekly_digest
Email templates for all notification types

technicalNotes.table: notifications (id, user_id, type, title, message, data_json, read_at, delivery_channels, created_at)
technicalNotes.bundling: Group notifications by type + target within time window (e.g., 1 hour)
technicalNotes.email: Bull queue processes email delivery with rate limiting
technicalNotes.push: Use web-push library for browser push notifications

tasks.title: Build notification UI components
tasks.description: Create notification bell, dropdown, and notifications page
acceptanceCriteria: Each notification: icon, title, message, timestamp, read/unread indicator
Click notification marks as read and navigates to relevant page
See all link â†’ notifications page
Full notification list with infinite scroll
Filter by: all, unread, type (news, forum, jobs, social)

technicalNotes.realtime: WebSocket or polling every 30s for new notifications
technicalNotes.sound: Play audio file on new notification if enabled in preferences

tasks.title: Build notification preferences UI
tasks.description: Create settings page for notification customization
acceptanceCriteria: Per section: list of notification types
Each type: toggle enable/disable, channel checkboxes (in-app, email, push), frequency selector
Frequency options: real-time, hourly, daily, weekly, off
Do-not-disturb schedule: start time, end time, days

technicalNotes.test: Send test push notification button triggers test notification

tasks.title: Implement email digest system
tasks.description: Create automated email digests (daily, weekly) with personalized content
acceptanceCriteria: Daily digest cron job runs at user's preferred time
Weekly digest runs every Monday at 9am user's timezone
Digest includes: top stories, trending discussions, new job matches, activity summary
Personalized based on user interests and follows
Email template: responsive HTML with sections
Skip digest if no relevant content
Rate limiting: max 1 digest per day per user

technicalNotes.cron: Bull queue with cron expression, process per-user digest generation
technicalNotes.personalization: Query followed categories, tags, models for relevant content
technicalNotes.tracking: Use SendGrid tracking or custom pixel/link tracking

tasks.title: Implement endorsement system backend
tasks.description: Create skill endorsement feature for candidate profiles
acceptanceCriteria: One endorsement per user per skill
Notification to profile owner on endorsement

technicalNotes.table: skill_endorsements (user_id, profile_id, skill_id, created_at), UNIQUE(user_id, profile_id, skill_id)

tasks.title: Build endorsement UI
tasks.description: Add endorsement buttons and display to profile skills
acceptanceCriteria: Endorse button on each skill in profile
Button shows: '+ Endorse' or 'Endorsed' (if already endorsed)
Click count shows list of endorsers (modal or tooltip)

tasks.title: Implement activity feed backend
tasks.description: Create activity tracking and feed for user actions
acceptanceCriteria: Activity types: posted_article, created_topic, replied, upvoted, bookmarked, applied_job, earned_badge, followed_user
Activity privacy: public, community, private (respects profile settings)
GET /api/following/feed returns activity from followed users

technicalNotes.table: user_activities (user_id, activity_type, target_type, target_id, privacy, created_at)
technicalNotes.index: INDEX on (user_id, created_at DESC), INDEX on (activity_type, created_at DESC)

tasks.title: Build activity feed UI
tasks.description: Display user activity on profiles and following feed
acceptanceCriteria: Activity timeline with icons per type
Each activity: icon, action description, target link, timestamp
Following feed shows activity from followed users

tasks.title: Implement 'Who Viewed My Profile' feature
tasks.description: Track profile views and display to premium users
acceptanceCriteria: Deduplicate: one view per viewer per 24h
GET /api/profiles/me/views returns who viewed profile (premium only)
Include: viewer name, photo, company (if recruiter), viewed_at
Anonymous view option (paid feature for viewers)
Privacy: users can disable view tracking

tasks.title: Build profile views UI
tasks.description: Display profile viewers to premium users
acceptanceCriteria: List of recent viewers with avatar, name, headline, viewed date
Anonymous viewers shown as 'Someone viewed your profile'

technicalNotes.paywall: Show teaser + upgrade button if not premium

tasks.title: Test notifications and social features
tasks.description: Test notification system, digests, endorsements, activity feed, and profile views
acceptanceCriteria: Notification bell shows correct unread count
Email digests send with correct content
Following feed aggregates followed users' activity

scenarios: Trigger various notifications and verify delivery
Configure notification preferences and verify enforcement
View activity feed for user and following
View profile viewers as premium user

notes: Sprint 13 adds critical engagement features. Notifications must be reliable and not overwhelming - smart bundling is essential. Email digests should provide value, not spam. Social features (endorsements, activity feed, profile views) build community and credibility.
risks: Notification volume may become overwhelming - bundling and frequency control critical
Email deliverability may be challenging - ensure proper SPF/DKIM/DMARC
Real-time notifications may require WebSocket infrastructure - decide on polling vs WebSocket
